name: Colosseum
description: Monumental 3-tiered Roman amphitheater once used for gladiatorial games, with guided tour option.

name: St. Peter's Basilica
description: Late Renaissance church by architects including Michelangelo & holding up to 20,000 worshippers.

name: Roman Forum
tagline: Excavated heart of the Roman Empire
description: Vast excavated area of Roman temples, squares & government buildings, some dating back 2,000 years.

name: Pantheon
description: Iconic temple built circa 118 to 125 A.D. with a dome & Renaissance tombs, including Raphael's.

name: Trevi Fountain
description: Aqueduct-fed rococo fountain, designed by Nicola Salvi & completed in 1762, with sculpted figures.

name: Vatican Museums
description: Multiple galleries of classical & Renaissance art masterpieces, plus the Sistine Chapel frescoes.

name: Sistine Chapel
description: Famous chapel in the Vatican Museums, best known for Michelangelo's 16th-century painted ceiling.

name: Piazza Navona
tagline: Elegant square with a fountain & bars
description: Elegant square dating from the 1st century A.D., with a classical fountain, street artists & bars.

name: Spanish Steps
description: Steps with irregular butterfly-shaped design, built in 18th century at French diplomat's bequest.

name: Castel Sant'Angelo
description: Circular, 2nd-century castle housing furniture & paintings collections in Renaissance apartments.

name: Palatine Hill
description: Legendary founding site of the city & home to ruins of Roman Imperial palaces, temples & baths.

name: Villa Borghese gardens
description: Lavish villa designed by Ponzio & Vasanzio, with formally landscaped gardens & a lake.

name: Trevi
description: Rione II is a lively neighborhood where camera-wielding crowds descend day and night to toss coins in the iconic, baroque-era Trevi Fountain. Piazza Barberini is the site of Bernini’s 17th-century

name: St. Peter's Square
description: Landmark square with columns, fountains & Egyptian obelisk where crowds gather for Pope's address.

name: Capitoline Hill
description: Hilltop square designed by Michelangelo, lined with museums & offering views of the Roman forum.

name: Piazza Venezia
tagline: Imposing square, home to Palazzo Venezia
description: Square with an elaborate Victorian monument known as 'the typewriter' by locals & Palazzo Venezia.

name: Piazza di Spagna
description: Refined 18th-century square, location of the Spanish Steps & the Church of Trinità dei Monti.

name: Piazza del Popolo
tagline: Landmark square by city's northern gate
description: Grand, landmark square centered by Rome's oldest obelisk & the site of the city's northern gate.

name: Galleria Borghese
description: Villa housing 15th- to 18th-century artworks with pieces by Bernini & Caravaggio. Booking essential.

name: Campo de' Fiori
tagline: Bustling produce market in public square
description: Popular local produce market in a public square, selling fruit, vegetables & general goods.

name: Altare della Patria
description: Grand marble, classical temple honoring Italy's first king & First World War soldiers.

name: Santa Maria Maggiore
description: Landmark papal basilica founded in the 5th century & known for its Roman mosaics & gilded ceiling.

name: Circus Maximus
tagline: Stone arena for vast Roman assemblies
description: Green space & remains of a stone & marble arena that could seat 250,000 Romans for chariot races.

name: Bocca della Verità
tagline: Mythical stone carving of a man's face
description: Carving of man's face on ancient manhole cover, a popular attraction due to the myth attached to it.

name: Capitoline Museums
description: Classical Roman, Greek & Egyptian sculptures & Renaissance art in 15th-century-designed palaces.

name: Tiber
description: The Tiber is the third-longest river in Italy, rising in the Apennine Mountains in Emilia-Romagna and flowing 406 kilometres through Tuscany, Umbria and Lazio, where it is joined by the river

name: Archbasilica of St. John Lateran
description: Landmark cathedral, the Pope's official seat, with ornate 1700s facade & statues of the Apostles.

name: Villa d'Este
tagline: Grand house in exotic hillside gardens
description: Grand 16th-century cardinal's villa in exotic hillside gardens with elaborate fountains & grottoes.

name: Baths of Caracalla
tagline: Ruins of a vast Roman bath complex
description: Ruins of a vast rectangular-shaped Roman thermal bath complex used from around 216 A.D. to 537 A.D.

name: Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi
description: Classical 17th-century fountain, a homage to 4 rivers, featuring a Roman obelisk topped by a dove.

name: Arch of Constantine
description: A 21m-high Roman structure made up of 3 arches decorated with figures & battle scenes.

name: Ponte Sant'Angelo
tagline: Ancient bridge built by Emperor Hadrian
description: Pedestrian bridge, built in 134 A.D., with travertine marble fascias & spanning the River Tiber.

name: Hadrian's Villa
description: Remains and 40-hectare excavation site of Roman villa with museum & visitor centre.

name: Janiculum
tagline: Popular terrace for sweeping city views
description: This historic, well-known hilltop terrace offers panoramic views of Rome.

name: Quirinal Palace
description: Former royal & papal residence, now the presidential palace & museum, on piazza offering city views.

name: Tiber Island
description:
The Tiber Island is the only island in the part of the Tiber which runs through Rome. Tiber Island is located in the southern bend of the Tiber.
The island is boat-shaped, approximately 270 metres

name: Aventine Hill
description: The Aventine Hill is one of the Seven Hills on which ancient Rome was built. It belongs to Ripa, the twelfth rione, or ward, of Rome.

name: Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls
tagline: Elegant papal basilica & St Paul's tomb
description: Magnificent papal basilica dating from the 4th century, with tomb of St Paul & elegant cloisters.

name: Pincian Hill
description: Historic promenade featuring 200+ busts of prominent figures, gardens & picturesque city views.

name: Arch of Titus
description: Triumphal arch with inscriptions & sculptures honoring the military victories of Emperor Titus.

name: Largo di Torre Argentina
tagline: Roman ruins & home to a cat colony
description: Archaeological site close to where Julius Caesar was killed, also home to a colony of cats.

name: Domus Aurea
tagline: Remains of Nero's grand villa complex
description: Remains of Emperor Nero's grand 3-floor villa complex, originally decorated with colorful frescoes.

name: Trajan's Column
description: A carved frieze winds up around the outside of this column erected upon victory in the Dacian wars.

name: Catacombs of Rome
description: The Catacombs of Rome are ancient catacombs, underground burial places under Rome, Italy, of which there are at least forty, some discovered only in recent decades. Though most famous for Christian

name: Trajan's Market
description: Roman shopping center with preserved forums, great hall markets & archaeological exhibits.

name: EUR, Rome
description: EUR is a residential and business district in Rome, Italy, located south of the city centre. The area was originally chosen in 1930s as the site for the 1942 world's fair which Benito Mussolini

name: Via Veneto
description: Via Vittorio Veneto, colloquially called Via Veneto, is one of the most famous, elegant, and expensive streets of Rome, Italy. The street is named after the Battle of Vittorio Veneto, a decisive

name: Aurelian Walls
tagline: Part-ruined city walls built by Romans
description: Well-preserved sections of the walls built 271–275AD under Roman emperors Aurelian & Probus.

name: Pyramid of Cestius
tagline: Egyptian pyramid tomb built by Romans
description: Egyptian-style pyramid with a frescoed interior, built as a tomb for a rich Roman magistrate.

name: Piazza Barberini
description: Late Medieval square with Gian Lorenzo Bernini's 17th-century Triton Fountain at its center.
